Project.Brief history of your project and organi: The Weather Program Office (WPO), part of NOAAâ€™s Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research, funds and advances collaborative weather research. It transitions science into accurate, actionable forecasts to build a Weather-Ready Nation.WPO partners with the National Weather Service, academia, government, and industry, focusing on tropical cyclones, severe storms, fire weather, air quality, and social science.Shaped by the 2017 Weather Research and Forecasting Innovation Act, WPO drives priorities in modeling, observations, and research-to-operations. Today, it operates through four divisions, supports the Unified Forecast System, and promotes open-science innovation.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
The NOAA NWS HAFS dataset on AWS Open Data Registry contains output from the Hurricane Analysis and Forecast System (HAFS), NOAA's next-generation multi-scale hurricane model. It provides operational forecasts up to 7 days for track, intensity (including rapid intensification), size, genesis, storm surge, rainfall, and tornadoes. Data includes event-driven forecast cycles (e.g., from 2022 Atlantic season) in GRIB2/NetCDF formats, stored in the S3 bucket s3://noaa-nws-hafs-pds.

s3://noaa-nws-hafs-pds	1.0 PiB
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset:
1. Downloading files from s3://noaa-nws-hafs-pds using AWS CLI or boto3.
2. To pack data into CAR files (Content Addressable Archives) with each file under 32GB
3. Copy the CAR files to a hard drive, then ship the hard drive to the storage  provider.
4. storage  provider import deals ,verification & activation
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Asia other than Greater China, North America
